column4: Lol! I had a GPU temp of 65 and a CPU temp of 53 in Idle.. I turned my computer over tried to loosen the lid to clean it...didnt find a matching screwdriver so I flipped it over again and now my CPU idle is 36 and my GPU is 54
Weird!
not weired at all. you should open the case for sure!
Yes I know but I didnt open it, couldnt find a matching screwdriver so I just turned it on again and just by doing that I lowered my idle temps by 10 degrees

yes, i know but thats just a side-effect: 1) your box got hot during use. 2) you turned it off, hence it cooled down. 3) you turn it on, everything seems fine, but if you start over heavy using it again, it will get hot again

because once there is a dust layer coating the cooler, new dust will easily append to that layer and cause your problem all-over again. wont take more than 1-2 weeks and it will stress your components way more than necessary over time. so clean your box up twice a year
Allright, I'll go by a matching screwdriver today :)
but 43 degrees CPU idle tempereature isnt bad right?
a side-effect might be, that the cooler will sound louder, because all the dust did absorb some of its sound
I dont have a problem with fan noise :)
no, its perfectly ok, if it stays that way.
I've only had this laptop for 5 months anyways
So I guess its time for my first cleaning
my old X850XT GPU is the loudest component of my entire box. i will soon replace it with the onboard graphics but until intrepid that one is not supported properly.
why didnt you tell me it is a laptop. do not open the laptop, it is much easier
do you have a vacuum cleaner, that is capable of reversing thrust?
so it blows out?
I dont think so...
some vacuum cleaners can do that. read the manual.
So instead of opening it I just take my vacuum cleaner and point it at the fan opening? Wont that just make the dust fly around inside the laptop?

because if it can, simply do that, go outside with your laptop and vcleaner and set it to full blow with the smallest nozzle you have. hold it about 30cm away from the openings of the laptop and blow in while moving the nozzle from left to right.
it'll blow out the dust without opening it.
Allright thanks but lets do what ikonia says then :) Thanks alot :)
np
